document.masterDocTitle: The female of Xysticus pseudorectilineus (Wunderlich, 1995) (Araneae: Thomisidae) from Turkey

Carapace dark red brown with yellowish spots and yellow V-shaped mark. ALE and PLE tubercles cream-coloured, margins of carapace black. Sternum, labium and maxillae yellow with brown spots. Chelicerae brown to yellow. Legs; femora and patellae I and II dark red brown, tibia I and II brown, distally lighter than proximally, metatarsi and tarsi yellow, femora, patellae and tibia III and IV light brown with dark brown spots, metatarsi and tarsi light yellow. Leg I spination: femur d 1–1–1, p 1–1–1–1, tibia v 2–2–2–2ap, p and r 1–1–1, metatarsus v 2–2–2–2ap, p 1–1–1ap, r 0–1–1ap Dorsum of abdomen white with black and red spots and 4 wide trensverse stripes, venter of abdomen with reddish spots. Spinnerets yellow brown, branchial opercula light brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–2.
Xysticus pseudorectilineus ( Wunderlich, 1995 )
. 1 epigyne, ventral view; 2 vulva, dorsal view. Scales: 0.2 mm.

FIGURES 3–4.
Xysticus pseudorectilineus ( Wunderlich, 1995 )
. Epigyne, ventral view. Scales: 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pedipalps ( Figs 5–6 ). Tibia with ventral, intermediate and retrolateral apophyses. Ventral apophysis broad, oblique, hammerlike, curved inwardly and at basis with a small protrusion. Intermediate apophysis large, oblong, leaflike in ventral view. Retrolateral apophysis long, thick, pointed and slightly inclined. Tutaculum cuplike. Tegulum centrally with large, round swelling giving rise to encircling embolar duct, and central to upper part with crescentlike tegular apophysis, backed by two tiny black arches. Tip of embolus bends slightly to tutacular edge and upper part of embolus with a clubslike protrusion.

Carapace brown with yellowish spots and yellow V-shaped mark. Eyes tubercles yellow. Sternum, labium and maxillae yellow with small brown spots. Chelicerae yellow with brown spots. Legs sandy-coloured with brown dorsal stripes and red brown spots. Carapace and abdomen dorsally covered with numerous thick hairs. Leg I spination: femur p 1–1– 1, tibia v 1–2–2–2ap, metatarsus v 2–2–2–2ap, p and r 0–1–1ap Dorsum of abdomen light brown with dark brown and black spots and transverse stripes, venter of abdomen with small black spots. Spinnerets brownish, branchial opercula yellow.

Epigyne ( Figs 1–4 ). Epigynal plate on upper part with central transparent, rounded, hoodlike structure, accompanied on each side by large, sclerotized dark lateral caps. Central part of epigynal plate with dark, large winding folds on each side. Spermathecal structures show no variation.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 5–6.
Xysticus pseudorectilineus ( Wunderlich, 1995 )
. Left male palp (5 ventral view, 6 retrolateral view).

FIGURE 7. Habitus of
Xysticus pseudorectilineus ( Wunderlich, 1995 )
.

FIGURE 8. Records of
Xysticus pseudorectilineus ( Wunderlich, 1995 )
in Turkey.
